alert.note: Alert for Arenac (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 23 at 12:02PM EDT until March 27 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Gaylord
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Michigan... Rifle River near Sterling affecting Arenac County. For the Rifle River...including Sterling...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rifle River near Sterling. * WHEN...Until early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, High water begins to impact canoe livery at River View Campground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 6.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage Thursday and continue to rise to 8.0 feet Friday. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday night. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.0 feet on 03/22/1955. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (2 pm EDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Rifle River Sterling 6.0 6.0 Wed 11 am ED 6.6 8.0 6.3 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by 1100 PM EDT or as new forecast information becomes available.
